DataElement.preferredDefinition: The extent of radiation exposure administered to the patient's body during radiation therapy.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Procedure Domain Radiation Therapy Administration Extent
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure._Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Concepts.definition: A subject domain utilized for the submission of information encompassing and representing data, vocabulary or records related to procedure.

Property.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
The range, magnitude, or distance over which a thing spans an interval of distance, space, or time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: An organizational header for concepts representing mostly abstract entities.

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: Released. AK 2020-6-11; Created for CDSIC aligned NCI Standard CRFs. ghd

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A set of categories to describe radiation therapy.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer therapy using ionizing radiation to a significant (>50%) portion of the body, e.g. craniospinal, total body irradiation, or pelvic radiation.

Concepts.definition: Cancer therapy using ionizing radiation to a significant (>50%) portion of the body, e.g. craniospinal, total body irradiation, or pelvic radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cancer therapy using ionizing radiation to < 50% of the body.

Concepts.definition: Cancer therapy using ionizing radiation to < 50% of the body.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

Concepts.definition: Treatment of a disease by means of exposure of the target or the whole body to radiation. Radiation therapy is often used as part of curative therapy and occasionally as a component of palliative treatment for cancer. Other uses include total body irradiation prior to transplantation.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ReferenceDocuments.name: CDISC Aligned NCI Standard Equivalent CDE
ReferenceDocuments.description: This data element is to be used for CDISC aligned data collection in place of CDE 2003339 from the original NCI Standard CRF Template.
